title: rustdoc ICE: entered unreachable code on hidden tuple item

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-beta
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to beta.

body:
### Code ```Rust pub enum Foo { Test(#[doc(hidden)] Option<()>), } ``` panics when running `cargo doc`. This seems to come from https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/ed30993456224998db3a8f347a286f8234cd75c8/src/librustdoc/html/render/print_item.rs#L943 cc #88391 ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.56.0-nightly (50171c310 2021-09-01) binary: rustc commit-hash: 50171c310cd15e1b2d3723766ce64e2e4d6696fc commit-date: 2021-09-01 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.56.0-nightly LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` cargo doc --no-deps Documenting hidden v0.1.0-rc.1 (G:\workspace\small dev space\test_crate-version) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'internal error: entered unreachable code', src\librustdoc\html\render\print_item.rs:943:80 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic error: Unrecognized option: 'crate-version' error: could not document `hidden` Caused by: process didn't exit successfully: `rustdoc --edition=2018 --crate-type lib --crate-name hidden src\lib.rs -o "G:\workspace\small dev space\test_crate-version\target\doc" --error-format=json --json=diagnostic-rendered-ansi -L "dependency=G:\workspace\small dev space\test_crate-version\target\debug\deps" --crate-version 0.1.0-rc.1` (exit code: 1) ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'internal error: entered unreachable code', src\librustdoc\html\render\print_item.rs:943:80 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7ff80a64801e - ::fmt::h97844c02df23ebf1 1: 0x7ff80a6728da - core::fmt::write::h7e004fee938dc3bd 2: 0x7ff80a63b388 - ::fmt::h34e482c524fdd2ee 3: 0x7ff80a64bab6 - std::panicking::take_hook::hd051283b0b015437 4: 0x7ff80a64b5c8 - std::panicking::take_hook::hd051283b0b015437 5: 0x7ff80390ad95 - ::flush::h7054a9d890538508 6: 0x7ff80a64c3b0 - std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook::h1dfae7c828339eef 7: 0x7ff80a64be3f - rust_begin_unwind 8: 0x7ff80a648947 - ::fmt::h97844c02df23ebf1 9: 0x7ff80a64bdc9 - rust_begin_unwind 10: 0x7ff80a6a8980 - core::panicking::panic_fmt::hec18c52ab5ec8c2e 11: 0x7ff80a6a88cc - core::panicking::panic::h5cccc34aab9ab48d 12: 0x7ff707957d6c - 13: 0x7ff70794a0b7 - 14: 0x7ff70793c43f - 15: 0x7ff707947276 - 16: 0x7ff707a41406 - 17: 0x7ff70785ede5 - 18: 0x7ff70797661a - 19: 0x7ff70789aab3 - 20: 0x7ff70796e8f4 - 21: 0x7ff70789cf3a - 22: 0x7ff70789363a - 23: 0x7ff7079e6296 - 24: 0x7ff707978de8 - 25: 0x7ff70791d68d - 26: 0x7ff80a65a64c - std::sys::windows::thread::Thread::new::h4e02b30388f9fde7 27: 0x7ff8dec054e0 - BaseThreadInitThunk 28: 0x7ff8dfa2485b - RtlUserThreadStart ```
